summary: In this context, Buta-1,3-diene is mentioned as one of the volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that can accumulate in indoor air and is classified as a carcinogen by the International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC). It is part of a broader category of organic chemicals that contribute to indoor air pollution, which poses health risks, particularly for children. The relationship highlights the significance of Buta-1,3-diene within the larger group of organic chemicals that are associated with increased cancer risk due to exposure.
